name: Telegram Operator
description:
Game worked on for the GMTK Game Jam 2019, "One Only"

You play a young man who has been enlisted in the Army during WWII as a telegram operator. Move through the units, from a cushy desk to the front lines as you make sure critical information is sent as fast and efficiently as possible. 

So my game works with a single button. All you need is the "space" button

Sadly, the team I was expecting didn't happen, so my game isn't really a game, but more of a prototype.

The idea was that each level has your operator moving through to more dangerous positions in the war. And that in each levels, there are 3 "scenarios", each with a slightly more complex message to send than the last.

And when you move to the next level, the percentage of mistakes you're allowed goes down as well.

But right now, all you can do is have the operator print messages.
